intro: Conicosia robusta, commonly known as the robust conicosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Conicosia robusta is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
